alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Montgomery; Robertson; Sumner (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:02PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Davidson, east central Montgomery, southwestern Sumner, northeastern Cheatham and central Robertson Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near White House to near Greenbrier to 6 miles west of Coopertown. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gallatin, Springfield, Ashland City, Madison, Hendersonville, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Coopertown, Lakewood, Ridgetop, Cross Plains, Old Hickory, Joelton, Pleasant View, Orlinda, Whites Creek and Beaman Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 89 and 112. Interstate 24 between mile markers 14 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
